page.title: 06BIDDISHAM
page.content: BIDDISHAM IS A STRAGLING SOMERSET VILLAGE WHICH HAS A FEW OF ITS HOUSES ON THE A38.BUT THE BULK OF THE PEOPLE LIVE ON A ROAD LEADING NORTH FROM THE A38 TOWARDS LOXTON.BUT IT STOPS ONE FIELD AWAY. THE VILLAGE CONSISTS MAINLY OF COTTAGE TYPE HOUSES SITTING WITHIN WELL TENDED GARDENS.EACH HAS AN AIR OF PEACE AND CALM,AN ATMOSPHERE WHICH SEEMS TO PERMEATE THE AREA ONCE THE A38 IS LEFT BEHIND. ITS CHURCH IS PEACEFUL.FOR MUCH OF ITS LENGTH,THE ROAD IS FLANKED BY THE OLD RIVER AXE.THE FIELDS ALONG THE BANKS CONTAIN LUSH GRASS OR CUT HAY READY FOR WINTER STORAGE.CATTLE GRAZED QUIETLY. ON THE EDGE OF THE RIVER,A HERON STOOD IMOBILE SEARCHING FOR ITS MEAL AND THUS DEPRIVE A NEARBY ANGLER OF HIS CATCH. A TRULY RURAL SCENE.
